decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful equipment cards to deal heavy damage to the opponent. By using cards like Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe in combination with Sigarda's Aid, Fervent Champion, and Kellan, the Fae-Blooded, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient attacks. The inclusion of protection spells like Sheltered by Ghosts and Hardlight Containment helps to keep the deck's key creatures safe while maintaining pressure on the opponent. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Elspeth to generate advantage and close out the game. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds a tribal element for additional value. The land base is designed to ensure consistency and provide mana for the deck's powerful spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The deck is focused on utilizing cheap spells and card selection to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes, which can then be brought back to the battlefield for aggressive attacks. The deck aims to efficiently use instants and sorceries to trigger the Phoenix's ability, while also controlling the opponent's board with removal spells. Combining card advantage, tempo plays, and aggressive threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Emberheart Challenger, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of spells like Reckless Rage and Stock Up further enhances the deck's ability to control the board and deal with opposing threats. The deck also includes mana-fixing lands like Riverpyre Verge and Shivan Reef to ensure smooth gameplay and consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to use Lotus Field to generate a significant amount of mana in order to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Crumbling Vestige to ramp up mana quickly, the deck aims to set up a game-winning combo using Lotus Field's mana doubling effect. The deck also includes some control elements like Thassa's Oracle and Overboard Analyst to protect the combo and ensure victory. Additionally, the deck includes lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Port of Karfell to provide additional utility and protection.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggressive plays, utilizing cards that deal damage quickly and efficiently. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells, using cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage directly to the opponent while maintaining board presence. The inclusion of cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Stock Up help to keep the pressure on by providing additional resources and card advantage. The mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and creatures, ensuring a steady stream of threats to the opponent.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to deal damage quickly and efficiently by utilizing low-cost creatures with prowess and spells that enhance their abilities. By combining aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger with spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain board control. The deck also includes cards like Academic Dispute and Stock Up to draw cards and maintain momentum. The mana base is optimized for consistent mana production to ensure the deck can execute its aggressive game plan effectively.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes a companion card, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, to provide additional support and synergy with the other cards. With key cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Supreme Verdict, and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value and card advantage to pull ahead in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble and protect a powerful Lotus Field combo, utilizing cards like Scapeshift and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods to generate mana and win conditions. By ramping up mana through lands like Hedge Maze and Crumbling Vestige, the deck aims to generate a large amount of resources to execute its game-winning combo. Additionally, cards like Thassa's Oracle and Stock Up provide alternative win conditions, making the deck versatile in its approach to victory. The goal is to efficiently set up the combo while disrupting opponents and securing the win.

This Selesnya Aggro deck relies on a fast-paced strategy of playing low-cost creatures like Bishop of Wings and Llanowar Elves to quickly build a board presence. With cards like Righteous Valkyrie and Resplendent Angel boosting the power of your creatures and gaining life, you can overwhelm your opponent in the early game. Collected Company helps you find additional threats quickly, while Skyclave Apparition can deal with troublesome enemy creatures. The deck aims to pressure your opponent and maintain a strong board presence to secure victory.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro Pioneer deck is to quickly play creatures and control the board with disruptive cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with early creature drops like Elvish Mystic and Skyclave Apparition while also utilizing powerful spells like Collected Company to generate advantage. The deck is designed to have a fast and aggressive start, packing a mix of creatures with various abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure a quick victory.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and targeted removal spells, focusing on efficient damage output and disruption. The key strategy revolves around utilizing powerful Rakdos creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, along with versatile removal spells such as Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also includes hand disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and control the board to secure a quick victory against the opponent.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By combining early aggression with hand disruption and removal spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily reducing their life total. Key cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help control the board and strip the opponent of important resources, while creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger deliver consistent damage. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive and fast-paced strategy, using efficient creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly. Spells like Stock Up, Reckless Rage, and Stormchaser's Talent help to control the board and push through damage. The deck also includes some card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistent plays. The goal is to apply pressure early and maintain momentum to outpace the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By combining creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear with combat tricks like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of card draw spells like Academic Dispute and Guiding Voice helps to maintain momentum and ensure a steady stream of threats. With a mana base that prioritizes fast, untapped land sources, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the very beginning of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive and proactive plays. By combining creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves with powerful cards like Collected Company and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence while utilizing disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponent's strategies. The key is to establish a strong board presence quickly and maintain pressure throughout the game to come out victorious.
